result.execSummary:
All charges against Sherry C. Olson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sherry C. Olson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sherry C. Olson

defendant.name: Olson, Sherry C.
defendant.address: 218 W Charlotte St. #303, River Falls, WI 54022

records.addlTxt: 1:34 PM Defendant Sherry C. Olson in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Sherry C. Olson.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin.  21CM225 and 22CM38 heard at this time. DA Hatch: guilty to Ct#2 in 22CM38 2 years probation: court costs ($543), no violent or abusive contact with Daniel Olson, AODA and F/T. Dismiss Ct#1 in 22cm38 and 21CM225. Atty Selmer and Defendant agree.Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights .Defendant pleas guilty to Ct#2 in 22CM38. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#2 in 22CM38. 1:43 Court recesses for discussion on which case/charge. 1:45 Court resumes. Atty Selmer: Defendant prefers to plead guilty to 21CM225. DA Hatch agrees. Court reviews charges in 21CM225. Court vacates the plea as to Ct#2 in 22CM38. Defendant pleas guilty to 21CM225. Counsel stipulates to factual basis for plea. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds Defendant is freely, voluntarily and knowingly making plea and waiving constitutional rights. Court finds defendant guilty to 21CM225. Court dismisses 22CM38. DA Hatch and Atty Selmer address sentencing- joint recommendation for probation. Court orders S/W 2 years probation in 21CM225- court costs ($543), no abusive or violent contact with DLO, AODA and F/T, Provide DNA sample within 30 days. 2 days credit if probation is revoked. Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 1:59
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:05 PM Defendant Sherry C. Olson in court.  Attorney Scott Selmer in court for Sherry C. Olson.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CM225 and 22CM38 heard at this time.  Counsel requested a plea/sentencing date. Court set
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 26, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

NO ABUSIVE OR VIOLENT CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH D.L.O.

Compliance with any cases involving her child.

9:46 AM Defendant Sherry C. Olson appears in Court, Atty Jens Hubert Loberg, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. NG. ADA Walker is requesting a $2,500.00 SIBS w/conditions of AS, NAC D.L.O. and compliance w/any cases involving her child, no objection. Court so orders. Court adjourned at 9:49 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
